div1.p: The Justices of his Lordship's County Court of Transmit to the Justices of the Provincial Court here the following Record on an Appeal made by the said Ruth Howard from Howard County Court the whereof follows in these words viz.–
In the Records and Proceedings of Ann Arundell County Court amongst other things is Contained as follows viz.–

Ann Arundell County: At a County Court of the Most Honorable Charles Absolute Lord and proxy of the Provinces of Maryland and Avalon Lord Baron of Baltimore and hold at the City of Annapolis for the County of Ann Arundele the Second Tuesday of June being the thirteenth day of the June Month in the Sixth year of his Lordships Dominion Anno Dom. 1721
Present The Worshipfull: Mr. Josias Forogood Mr. Edwd. Benson Mr. Caleb Dorsey Mr. Wm. Chapman Lord Phillip Jones Mr. Samuel Smith Court Justices J. Beale Clk. Stephen Warman Sherr.

On the said Bess's Complaint against the said Ruth Howard to the Court here for her freedom the said Ruth Howard being present in Court. And Whereupon all and Singular the allegations assailed of the Negroe Bess as the said Ruth Howard being fully heard in relation to the premises and Mature Deliberation.– Moreupon had for that it Seems to the Court here that it was the Designe of Mrs. Anne Lambert Deceased the former Mistress of the said Negroe Bess that She Should be free at the Age of Twenty five years.–
It is therefore Considered by the Justices here that the said Negroe Bess be free at the Age of twenty five years.–

Whereupon the said Mrs. Ruth Howard the Mistress of the said Negroe Bess prays an Appeal from the Judgment of the Court to the next Provincal Court to be held for this Province which is granted and the Record ordered to be Transmitted Accordingly–
In Testimony whereof the Seal of Ann Arundell County is hereunto affixed John Beale Clk. of Ann Arundell County

And now here at this day to wit the 10 day of October Anno Domini 1721 Comes the said Ruth Howard by Thomas Bordley her attorney in to his Lordships Provinciall Court of Maryland before the Justices thereof and Saith that in the Record and process aforesaid in the Pondering the Judgement aforesaid this Manifestly End to wit in this that the Court having taken upon them to make a Negroe which is by Act of Assembly of this province declared a Slave for Life to become free at Twenty five years– Ago Contrary to the Express words of the same Act and to the great Annoyance of his Majestys Christian Subjects within this province by allowing these Africans the Enjoyment of Liberty & of Privledges Equal to those of English men whereas the Royall Charter of this province granted by his Majesty– progenitors to those of the Lord Proxy appears to have been for the planting an Ample Colony of the English Nation in these parts.–

In this that the Court Declared the reason of Setting her free was because it seemed to them it was the Design of her former Mistress Anne Lambert that She Should be free etc.but that it appears not that the said Anne Lambert had Executed these designes whilst it was in her Power to have rendered them Effectuale Nor that Ever she designed to set her free before she Disposed of her to the said Ruth Nor that the said Negroe was set free or designed to be set free by her Mistress for that time being but by her former Mistress whose Power was Determined.–

In this that the said Court ought to have given Judgment against the said Bess that She Should Continue a Slave and not that She Should be free at twenty five years of Age for all which and many Other Errors in the Record and Process aforesaid the said Ruth Howard prays that the Judgment be reverst and that She to all that She Hereby Lost may be restored that the said Bess to the Errors– aforesaid may rejoin and that the Court will proceed to Examine the same according to Law–

Whereupon the said Negro Bess in her proper person appears and Says that in the Record and proceedings and also in the rendering Judgement therein it is in nothing Erred and prays that the same Judgment may in all things be affirmed and there upon as well the said Negroe Bess as the said Ruth Howard by her attorney aforesaid pray the Court of the Lord Proxy here will proceed as well to the Equaniming of the Record and proceedings aforesaid as of the Matters above for Errors assigned.

Whereupon for that the Court here are not advised of their Judgment of and upon the premises day is given to the said parties to hear thereof their Judgment until next Court for that the said Court as yet are not At which said next Court to wit 10 day of Anno Dom 1782 Come again in as well the said Ruth Howard by her attorney and the said Negro Bess in hers.

And whereupon all and Singular the premises being by the Court now soon heard fully understood and Mature Deliberation whereupon had It is Considered by the Justices here the 10 day of April Anno Dom 1722 aforesaid that the Judgment aforesaid for the Error aforesaid be Annulled and altogether hold for None and that the said Ruth Howard too all things that thereby She hath lost be Restored And it is further Considered that the Said Negroe Bess Continue a Slave to the said Ruth Howard during her life.
